info.name: User support for ISPConfig mail accounts
info.summary: Allow users logging in using their mailbox credentials as managed via ISPConfig
info.description:
Using this authentication provider you allow your users to use login credentials from their mailboxes as managed by ISPConfig 3 hosting controlpanel.
To do so, you have to configure the URL of your panel server for API requests along with user credentials for a ISPConfig remote api user. See Readme for details: https://spicyhub.de/spicy-web/nextcloud-user-ispconfig/blob/master/README.md
Furthermore, you can set default quota and group memberships for all newly created users.
For users from specific domains you can add individual quota and group settings and also allow them to use simplified usernames, e.g. instead of john@doe.com just john or john.doe. For more information on this, take a look at prefix, suffix and bare-name configuration contained in the Readme file.
